title: Dim display in daylight
content:
Ok, so my screen display is basically impossible to see clearly in daylight. Even at 100%. It’s just soooooooooo dim. Not talking bright sunlight, just pretty much any outside daylight. I find myself having to find some shade to be able to write a text or read an email!

I’ve experimented with turning off adaptive brightness to no avail. Restarting, downloading latest updates and trying it out in safe mode have not improved the situation. A factory reset did nothing. I’m not using a screen protector. I’ve contacted customer support and their advice was simply to leave feedback via the device. The idea being, as I understand it, to wait and hope that the development team will eventually release a fix. Until then, I’m stuck with a device that I can only really use indoors.

Does anyone have any other suggestions? Is this normal for Pixels? It feels like a mobile issue from like 10 years ago. But I’m traditionally a Samsung Galaxy guy, so maybe it’s just an area Samsung had sorted and others are lagging behind. Nevertheless, slightly gobsmacked to encounter this issue on a premium flagship device in 2019!  

Any help soooooooo appreciated. Customer support have been useless so maybe you guys can do a better job.
